text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

When I was a kid,
adults always asked me

what I wanted to
be when I grow up.

The studious side
of me said a doctor.

The musical side of
me said a pianist.

However, over the years I've
realized that adults are
asking kids the wrong question.

The real question is,
what kind of change

do you want to
create in this world?

For me, I want to design a
future where everyone feels

empowered, especially
underrepresented voices so

that they can
believe in themselves
as the leaders of tomorrow.

Throughout my career I've seen
how feelings of imperfection

can cloud potential and
derail ambitions in myself
and also in others.

However, on the
flip side, I've also

seen how practicing
to say, I can,

celebrating failure, even
taking your first step

towards realizing your
mission can really unlock
confidence and opportunity.

So beyond HBS, I want
to work in a way which

empowers these people
so that they can enact

the future that they want
to create in a way that's
courageous and empathetic.
